Description: Rim and body sherd of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; interior: reserved line at top of rim, glazed black (fired reddish) below; exterior: streaky brown on rim and top of shoulder, reserved below; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The sherd was analysed with NAA by H. Mommsen (see Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006), sample Nauk 4, Group D. The place of production was identified as Miletus. Schlotzhauer identifies this sherd as coming from a Type 11,3.A South Ionian cup with everted rim. Very few Type 11 cups were found at Naukratis and Schlotzhauer suggests that these may have been made in specific workshops that rarely exported vases to Naukratis.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIII, no. 276)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 666, no. 237)
Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006 / East Greek Pottery from Naukratis: The Current State of Research (p. 59, fig. 21, Table 1)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 53, no. 373, NAU 56, pl.12f-g)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.253) (Phase 3)
